item.title: Assignment 1
item.description: This essay offers you practice at interpreting and finding reasons in texts and then doing your own analysis. Write at least 1500 words, developing a response to one of the numbered options below. First, review the Writing a Philosophy Paper handout. Then note: Write as if to a generally-competent reader who is not in the class and does not have a background in philosophy, rather than to, say, me. That means you will need to explain terms or concepts you mention, instead of assuming the reader has read the same material.

item.title: Interpreting Grades
item.description: This note about grading and interpreting grades just adds some detail to what the course syllabus already says about grading. 4-point scale Grades in this course are assigned and calculated using Hofstra’s 4-point scale (described here in the Hofstra Bulletin). Following the Bulletin, the alphabetical grades, including plus (+) and minus (–), have the following 4-point scale values (and vice versa): letter 4pt Student’s academic performance … A 4.
